intro: Planera abelicea, commonly known as the Chinese cliff brake, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in rocky or coastal areas and is often found growing on cliffs or in sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
